title: Drawing, "Three Bacchus Subjects: Bacchus Worshipped: Bacchus Marries Ariadne; Triumph of Bacchus", 1800
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and sepia wash over traces of graphite on laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed: sacrificio di Diana; ninfa di Diana (repeated twice).
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Bacchus shown enthroned in circular vaulted temple. Priest stands behind altar in background, while offerings are brought to Bacchus. Bacchus and Ariadne hold each other's hands. Woman behind them raises wreath. Two putti fly. Bacchus rides in his chariot drawn by panthers toward left. In left interval, pen sketch shown of arm holding pitcher. In right, one of pen sketch and man sacrificing wine. Part of framing is in center lower edge.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Three Bacchus Subjects: Bacchus Worshipped: Bacchus Marries Ariadne; Triumph of Bacchus", 1800.
1800. Pen and brown ink, brush and sepia wash over traces of graphite on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3315.
